page.title: 15FARMING AROUND RIPPINGALE
page.content: The crop of this{mainly arable}area is wheat,barley,oilseed rape,potatoes, sugarbeet and onions with a small acreage of blackcurrants and bulbs. Several smallholders grow lettuce and tomatoes.Some fat beef{cattle}and a milking herd are kept at Dunsby.Farms vary from{100 acres to 2,000 acres}and are{highly mechanised.}Unlike the past three field system,there is,nowadays, no crop rotation.Wheat and barley are harvested by combine,the moisture reduced to 14% in driers and stored until sold;some for bread and some for beer.The residue is used for cattle feed.Oilseed rape is harvested in July and,after processing,is used in cooking oil and margarine.After most of the crop is cleared,the land is ploughed and cultivated ready for drilling in September.Potatoes,onions and sugarbeet are lifted in Autumn.
